text.style: text-anchor: middle; font-family: Khand; font-size: 43.89px; fill: rgb(17, 17, 17); stroke: rgb(136, 136, 136); stroke-width: 0.5pt;
font-family: Khand; font-size: 24.871px; text-anchor: middle; fill: rgb(34, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(17, 17, 17); stroke-width: 0.05pt;
font-family: Gochi Hand; font-size: 24.871px; text-anchor: start; fill: rgb(68, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(102, 68, 68); stroke-width: 0.05pt;
text.tspan: A moot cannot open until this rite is completed, recharging the caern
with Gnosis. The rite always includes a prolonged howl led by a
werewolf known as the Master of the Howl. This howl varies by
tribe and sept, but always expresses the unique nature of the sept.
All werewolves present must form a circle within the caern itself
before they commence howling. Numerous variations on the basic
requirements exist: The Red Talons often bite their paws and
scratch blood into the earth, while Uktena pass their most powerful
fetish from one to another as each in turn adds her voice to the
howl. However it is done, the howl must echo forth and the eternal
circle must form.
-- System
Max Gnosis (diff 7) The rite must be performed at least once per
month to keep the caern consecrated. During the course of a moot,
the participants must empower the caern with a combined total of
five Gnosis points per caern level in order to replenish it fully.

text.style: font-family: Khand; font-size: 24.871px; text-anchor: middle; fill: rgb(34, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(17, 17, 17); stroke-width: 0.05pt;

g.text: Rite of the Questing Stone (Rite of Mystic level 1)

text.style: font-family: Gochi Hand; font-size: 24.871px; text-anchor: start; fill: rgb(68, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(102, 68, 68); stroke-width: 0.05pt;
text.tspan: This rite allows the werewolf to find a person or object (but not a
location). She must know the name of the object or individual, and
must dangle a stone or needle from a thread while concentrating on
the item or person sought. Glass Walkers often use maps and
substitute a compass for the traditional stone and thread.
-- System
Wits + Rituals (diff 7). If the Garou has a piece of the item or
individual (a clipping of hair, a piece of cloth) the difficulty drops by
one. The werewolf gains only a sense of the object’s general
location, not its exact position.

text.style: text-anchor: start; font-family: Gochi Hand; font-size: 24.871px; fill: rgb(68, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(102, 68, 68); stroke-width: 0.5pt;
text-anchor: end; font-family: Philosopher; font-size: 24.871px; fill: rgb(34, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(17, 17, 17); stroke-width: 0.5pt;
text-anchor: end; font-family: Philosopher; font-size: 24.871px; fill: rgb(34, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(17, 17, 17); stroke-width: 0.5pt;
text-anchor: start; font-family: Philosopher; font-size: 19.019px; fill: rgb(34, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(17, 17, 17); stroke-width: 0.5pt;
text-anchor: end; font-family: Philosopher; font-size: 19.019px; fill: rgb(34, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(17, 17, 17); stroke-width: 0.5pt;

g.text: WaWWoD Cross+Over Sheet 19.04 ©2024, Red Fox Studios.

text.style: text-anchor: end; font-family: Philosopher; font-size: 9.5095px; fill: rgb(34, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(17, 17, 17); stroke-width: 0.5pt;

g.text: Red Fox Studios are a subsidiary of Pentex Inc.

text.style: text-anchor: end; font-family: Philosopher; font-size: 19.019px; fill: rgb(34, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(17, 17, 17); stroke-width: 0.5pt;
